title: CVPR_2009_18_abs

sentences.text: We present a new method for detecting interest points using histogram information .

Unlike existing interest point detectors , which measure pixel-wise differences in image intensity , our detectors incorporate histogram-based representations , and thus can find image regions that present a distinct distribution in the neighborhood .
The proposed detectors are able to capture large-scale structures and distinctive textured patterns , and exhibit strong invariance to rotation , illumination variation , and blur .

The experimental results show that the proposed histogram-based interest point detectors perform particularly well for the tasks of matching textured scenes under blur and illumination changes , in terms of repeatability and distinctiveness .
An extension of our method to space-time interest point detection for action classification is also presented .

summary: We present a new method for detecting interest points using histogram information . Unlike existing interest point detectors , which measure pixel-wise differences in image intensity , our detectors incorporate histogram-based representations , and thus can find image regions that present a distinct distribution in the neighborhood . The proposed detectors are able to capture large-scale structures and distinctive textured patterns , and exhibit strong invariance to rotation , illumination variation , and blur . The experimental results show that the proposed histogram-based interest point detectors perform particularly well for the tasks of matching textured scenes under blur and illumination changes , in terms of repeatability and distinctiveness . An extension of our method to space-time interest point detection for action classification is also presented .

Predicate-present.label: present
Predicate-present.description: The predicate 'present' indicates that the subject is introducing or offering something to others. It suggests a sense of availability, accessibility, and often implies novelty or innovation. In this context, it connects the subject (We) with the object (a new method...) by highlighting our role in making this information available for consideration.

Predicate-using.label: using
Predicate-using.description: The predicate 'using' indicates the means or method by which a subject accesses, manipulates, or utilizes an object. It describes how the subject interacts with or leverages the object to achieve some purpose.

Predicate-incorporate.label: incorporate
Predicate-incorporate.description: To integrate or merge a subject's characteristics with those of an object to form a new entity that combines their properties.

Predicate-find.label: find
Predicate-find.description: The predicate 'find' indicates the act of discovering or locating something specific within a given context. It implies a process of searching, scanning, or examining to identify and connect with relevant information, entities, or patterns.

Predicate-measure_pixel-wise_differences.label: measure pixel-wise differences in image intensity
Predicate-measure_pixel-wise_differences.description: To quantify and compare the variations of an image's intensity at each individual pixel level.

Predicate-find_image_regions_that_presen.label: find image regions that present a distinct distribution in the neighborhood
Predicate-find_image_regions_that_presen.description: This predicate identifies and extracts specific subsets of data (image regions) based on their unique characteristics or patterns within a defined context or proximity ('neighborhood'). The subject entity, in this case 'our detectors', uses its capabilities to locate these distinct image regions that exhibit a particular distribution or arrangement.

Predicate-are_able_to_capture.label: are able to capture
Predicate-are_able_to_capture.description: Indicates that the subject has a capability or capacity to successfully grasp, comprehend, or understand the object. This predicate suggests a potential for effective interaction or processing between the subject and the object.

Predicate-match.label: match
Predicate-match.description: To match means to identify or correspond with a given object or pattern, often based on shared characteristics or features. This predicate establishes an equivalence relationship between the subject and object, suggesting that they share commonalities or similarities.

Predicate-perform.label: perform
Predicate-perform.description: To 'perform' means to accomplish or execute a task, action, or function with a certain level of quality, effectiveness, or efficiency. The predicate connects the subject (the entity performing) and object (the activity, process, or outcome being performed), indicating that the former is capable of achieving the latter.

Predicate-can_capture.label: can capture
Predicate-can_capture.description: The predicate 'can capture' indicates that the subject has the ability to perceive or comprehend the object. It suggests a capacity for understanding, grasping, or interpreting the characteristics of the object.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: Indicates that the subject concept is a more specific instance or subclass of the object concept. The predicate 'has a broader term' establishes a hierarchical relationship between the two concepts, where the subject is a narrower category within the scope defined by the object.
